New Records: Tarik Skubal achieved his 16th win of the season, the most in baseball.
Skubal lowered his MLB-best ERA to 2.51 through 168.1 innings.
Skubal now has 203 strikeouts, which tops baseball.
Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal allowed only four hits and struck out eight batters in eight innings.
Tyler O'Neill hit a home run in the top of the first inning.
Trey Sweeney hit a two-run double, scoring Zach McKinstry and Spencer Torkelson.
Tyler Holton closed out the game for the Tigers.
Pre-Game Insights: Detroit Tigers had slim playoff hopes and needed to win against Boston to stay in the wild card race.
Post-Match Reflections: Tarik Skubal's performance against Boston should all but sew up the Cy Young Award for him and cement his spot in the MVP race.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitching Triple Crown has not been accomplished in a 162-game season since Johan Santana did it in 2006.
